body_html: In this answer, it explains that the fact that you use .data when doing c_param.data = xxx means that you don't tract history and thus gradients won't flow back to the original parameters.
body_text: In this answer, it explains that the fact that you use .data when doing c_param.data = xxx means that you don't tract history and thus gradients won't flow back to the original parameters.
body: In [this](https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/autograd-isnt-functioning-when-networkss-parameters-are-taken-from-other-networks/27424/2) answer, it explains that the fact that you use `.data` when doing `c_param.data = xxx` means that you don't tract history and thus gradients won't flow back to the original parameters.
